original_solution_mapping.L1: When Bella buys 2/5 times more marbles, she'll have increased the number of marbles by 2/5*60 = <<2/5*60=24>>24
original_solution_mapping.L2: The total number of marbles she'll have is 60+24 = <<60+24=84>>84
original_solution_mapping.L3: If Bella currently has 60 marbles, and she has two times as many marbles as frisbees, she has 60/2 = <<60/2=30>>30 frisbees.
original_solution_mapping.L4: If Bella buys 2/5 times more frisbees, she'll have 2/5*30 = <<2/5*30=12>>12 more frisbees.
original_solution_mapping.L5: The total number of frisbees she'll have will increase to 30+12 = <<30+12=42>>42
original_solution_mapping.L6: Bella also has 20 more frisbees than deck cards, meaning she has 30-20 = <<20-10=10>>10 deck cards
original_solution_mapping.L7: If she buys 2/5 times more deck cards, she'll have 2/5*10 = <<2/5*10=4>>4 more deck cards.
original_solution_mapping.L8: The total number of deck cards she'll have is 10+4 = <<10+4=14>>14
original_solution_mapping.L9: Together, Bella will have a total of 14+42+84 = <<14+42+84=140>>140 items

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 669.
    Returns: the total number of items Bella will have.
    """
    # L1
    more_fraction = Fraction(2, 5) # 2/5 times more of each item
    current_marbles = 60 # currently has 60 marbles
    increased_marbles = more_fraction * current_marbles

    # L2
    total_marbles = current_marbles + increased_marbles

    # L3
    marbles_to_frisbees_ratio = 2 # two times as many marbles as frisbees
    current_frisbees = current_marbles / marbles_to_frisbees_ratio

    # L4
    increased_frisbees = more_fraction * current_frisbees

    # L5
    total_frisbees = current_frisbees + increased_frisbees

    # L6
    frisbees_more_than_cards = 20 # 20 more frisbees than deck cards
    current_deck_cards = current_frisbees - frisbees_more_than_cards

    # L7
    increased_deck_cards = more_fraction * current_deck_cards

    # L8
    total_deck_cards = current_deck_cards + increased_deck_cards

    # L9
    total_items = total_deck_cards + total_frisbees + total_marbles

    # FA
    answer = total_items
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: When Bella buys {more_fraction} times more marbles, she'll have increased the number of marbles by {more_fraction}*{current_marbles} = <<{more_fraction}*{current_marbles}={increased_marbles}>>{increased_marbles}
The total number of marbles she'll have is {current_marbles}+{increased_marbles} = <<{current_marbles}+{increased_marbles}={total_marbles}>>{total_marbles}

If Bella currently has {current_marbles} marbles, and she has two times as many marbles as frisbees, she has {current_marbles}/{marbles_to_frisbees_ratio} = <<{current_marbles}/{marbles_to_frisbees_ratio}={current_frisbees}>>{current_frisbees} frisbees.
If Bella buys {more_fraction} times more frisbees, she'll have {more_fraction}*{current_frisbees} = <<{more_fraction}*{current_frisbees}={increased_frisbees}>>{increased_frisbees} more frisbees.
The total number of frisbees she'll have will increase to {current_frisbees}+{increased_frisbees} = <<{current_frisbees}+{increased_frisbees}={total_frisbees}>>{total_frisbees}

Bella also has {frisbees_more_than_cards} more frisbees than deck cards, meaning she has {current_frisbees}-{frisbees_more_than_cards} = <<{frisbees_more_than_cards}-{current_deck_cards}={current_deck_cards}>>{current_deck_cards} deck cards

If she buys {more_fraction} times more deck cards, she'll have {more_fraction}*{current_deck_cards} = <<{more_fraction}*{current_deck_cards}={increased_deck_cards}>>{increased_deck_cards} more deck cards.
The total number of deck cards she'll have is {current_deck_cards}+{increased_deck_cards} = <<{current_deck_cards}+{increased_deck_cards}={total_deck_cards}>>{total_deck_cards}
Together, Bella will have a total of {total_deck_cards}+{total_frisbees}+{total_marbles} = <<{total_deck_cards}+{total_frisbees}+{total_marbles}={total_items}>>{total_items} items
